intro: Polycycnopsis aurita, commonly known as the golden star sedge, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of eastern North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers, which form dense, star-like clusters at the ends of its stems. It typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, thriving in marshy environments. Polycycnopsis aurita plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
